SUMMARY: transcription factor DicA, Division cell, is a temperature-sensitive repressor that controls transcription of genes involved in cell division process [3911021, 3532030, 3041373, 2666395] and activation of its own expression [23028867]. Neverless, signal to which DicA responds is still unknown. family to which DicA belongs has not been established; it is a protein of 15 kDa with a hypotical DNA-binding domain in N-terminal domain [3532030]. DicA is homologous in structure and function to RovA (Yersinia) and SlyA (Salmonella), both of which are activators for pathogenicity-related genes [23028867].
